author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I can in the first [AutoMerge test](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/actions/runs/3343728179/jobs/5537250646) that there is an error

```
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package Microgrids [bd581358]:
 Microgrids [bd581358] log:
 ├─possible versions are: 0.9.0 or uninstalled
 ├─restricted to versions 0.9.0 by an explicit requirement, leaving only versions 0.9.0
 └─restricted by julia compatibility requirements to versions: uninstalled — no versions left
```

However, I don't understand the root of the problem. I've added a julia compat line in my `Project.toml`:

```
julia = "~1.6"
```
which if I understood the [§Compatibility](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/compatibility/) chapter mean Julia version 1.6 and onwards (1.6.x, 1.7.x, 1.8,1.9...), until 2.x which is excluded. Am I correct?

Or is it uncommon to use a tilde specifier for Julia version compatibility ?

`~1.6` means `[1.6.0, 1.7.0)`, there are examples in the docs https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/compatibility/#Tilde-specifiers that you linked to.

> Or is it uncommon to use a tilde specifier for Julia version compatibility?

Yes. `^1.6` or, since `^` are default, just `1.6` is used by the majority of packages.

Edit: [noblock]

> `~1.6` means `[1.6.0, 1.7.0)`, there are examples in the docs https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/compatibility/#Tilde-specifiers that you linked to.

Oh yes, this is crystal clear in the doc. For some reason I misread it this morning, sorry.

I've updated the [compat] section with Julia version `1.6`.
What is strange is that I didn't get an error with compat `~1.6` when installing locally on my machine (on Julia 1.8).

Thanks for the feedback @fredrikekre, now all tests have passed!

There is still the tagging mentioned in https://github.com/Microgrids-X/Microgrids.jl/issues/2 that I need to do, but if I got it right, this should be done after the merge (to be sure to tag the actual final version...).
Is there something else that I should do to help the review of my package?
See https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General#automerge-is-blocked-by-one-of-my-comments-how-do-i-unblock-it, but I can merge it now.

> See https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General#automerge-is-blocked-by-one-of-my-comments-how-do-i-unblock-it, but I can merge it now.

Ah yes I had forgotten about this rule. Thanks @fredrikekre for merging my package PR and thanks for your patience with me (first contribution to the General registry).
